newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Yields fall on 1-, 4-wk Bulgarian discount T-bills.
newsitem.headline: Yields fall on 1-, 4-wk Bulgarian discount T-bills.

text.p: Yields to maturity fell by 0.21 and 0.31 points respectively at Bulgaria's Finance Ministry auctions of one-week and four-week discount T-bills on Tuesday, central bank figures showed.
The average yields to maturity of the two issues were 3.23 percent and 15.93 percent, respectively, down from 3.44 and 16.24 percent at Monday's auctions.
Bids were received for a total of 93.722 billion levs of T-bills for today's auctions but the ministry approved bids for 16.827 billion levs worth of paper.
The issues were offered with no par value or minimum acceptable price set in advance by the ministry. Auction date and maturity date for each issue overlap.
The ministry has issued one-week and four-week discount T-bills daily since January 20 to regulate banks' liquidity.
Details of the issues follow. Prices in percent of par:
Bids received 49,444.1 million levs 44,277.4 million levs
Bids approved 11,219.1 million levs 5,607.4 million levs
Avg yield to maturity 3.23 pct 15.93 pct
